thread.title: Dr. Sebastian Gorka On How You Can Defeat ISIS Without Making the Refugee Crisis Worse | John Gibson Radio Show
thread.title_full: Dr. Sebastian Gorka On How You Can Defeat ISIS Without Making the Refugee Crisis Worse | John Gibson Radio Show

title: Dr. Sebastian Gorka On How You Can Defeat ISIS Without Making the Refugee Crisis Worse | John Gibson Radio Show
text:
John Gibson Sep 15, 2016 
Colin Powell wrote in a jaw-dropping e-mail that he doesn’t want to vote for his pal Hillary Clinton because she’s a greedy defender of the status quo whose husband is “still ­d–king bimbos at home (according to the NYP)” — the New York Post. “I would rather not have to vote for her, although she is a friend I respect,” the former secretary of state wrote Democratic donor Jeffrey Leeds on July 26, 2014. “A 70-year person with a long track record, unbridled ambition, greedy, not transformational, with a husband still d–kng bimbos at home (according to the NYP),” reads the explosive e-mail obtained by the Web site DCLeaks. Powell sent the message just days after The Post revealed in May that Bill Clinton allegedly has a blond mistress who visits his Chappaqua home so often, she was dubbed “the Energizer” by the Secret Service. Dr. Sebastian Gorka, Major General Matthew C. Horner Distinguished Chair of Military Theory at Marine Corps University and author of the new book, Defeating Jihad: The Winnable War joins the John Gibson Show to discuss. 
Gibson and Dr. Gorka also discussed how ISIS can be defeated without making the refugee crisis in Europe worse and the news that Austrian Cardinal Christoph Schönborn has warned that Europe risks forfeiting its “Christian inheritance” and that an “Islamic conquest” could be in its future. What could this mean for Europe, and in turn, for the U.S.? Listen below to find out. Previous article
